content: Build Your Hugo Blog Using GitHub and Netlify
title: Ultimate guide to build your own blog

content: Before you start All hugo commands should be run in the root level
title: Ultimate guide to build your own blog
Ultimate guide to build your own blog

content: Step 1: Install hugo && git For Mac user: brew install hugo brew install git
title: Ultimate guide to build your own blog

content: Step 2: Create a new site hugo new site myblog cd myblog
title: Ultimate guide to build your own blog

content: Step 3: Add a theme You can find Hugo themes Here In this case I use LoveIt theme as my example git init git submodule add https://github.com/dillonzq/LoveIt.git themes/LoveIt
title: Ultimate guide to build your own blog

content: Step 4: Basic Configuration Copy config.toml content from example site to your config.toml You can make your own changes in config.toml file
title: Ultimate guide to build your own blog

content: Step 5: Create your first post hugo new posts/my-first-post.md In .md file, set: draft: false Command above will generate a my-first-post.md file under the path: ./content/posts You should always use hugo new posts/file.md to create new files
title: Ultimate guide to build your own blog

content: Step 6: Host the Website Locally hugo serve Go to http://localhost:1313
title: Ultimate guide to build your own blog

content: Step 7: Build the Website Run: hugo After you run the hugo command above, you will see content created under public folder in your blog folder
title: Ultimate guide to build your own blog
Ultimate guide to build your own blog

content: 1. Create a new repo on GitHub If you want to deploy on GitHub page: Create a repo named your-github-username.github.io For example: My GitHub username is code-panda-x My repo will be named code-panda-x.github.io
title: Ultimate guide to build your own blog

content: 2. Git Initialiaztion git add . git commit -m "first commit" git branch -M main git remote add origin https://github.com/your-github-username/your-repo-name.git git push -u origin main Whenever you make changes in your blog folder Run : hugo Above code will update corresponding changes to public folder Then run: $ git add . $ git commit -m "add blog post" $ git push You can use git status to check your changes $ git status
title: Ultimate guide to build your own blog

content: Deploy on Netlify Sign in Netlify with GitHub account Add new site - Import an existing project Select your GitHub repo Your site will be pubished with a netlify domain
title: Ultimate guide to build your own blog

content: Deploy on GitHub Page Your site will be published on your-github-username.github.io
title: Ultimate guide to build your own blog

content: Customize Domain Purchase your domain at Godaddy.com or namecheap.com Configuration
title: Ultimate guide to build your own blog

content: DNS Management Netlify Add: Type: A Name: @ Value: 75.2.60.5 (Netlify’s load balancer IP address) Type: CNAME Name: www Value: your-url.netlify.app GitHub Page Add: Type: A Name: @ Value: 185.199.108.153 Type: CNAME Name: www Value: your-github-username.github.io
title: Ultimate guide to build your own blog

content: Host Settings Netlify Domains - Custom domains - Add custom domain - Enter your purchased domain GitHub Page Settings - Code and automation - Custom domain - Enter your purchased domain
title: Ultimate guide to build your own blog
